domino_project

Interface Player

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Bot, Human

    public interface Player
    This interface represents a Player(Bot or Human) in a DominoGame.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addPoints(int x)
      * Adds a specified number of points(x) to their points.
      void ClearHand()
      Their current hand gets cleared and a new one is created.
      void fillhand(SetOfTiles set)
      Fills their hand with a SetOfTiles.
      SetOfTiles getHand()
      Returns their hand.
      int getHandpoints()
      Gets the total points from every Tile(sum) on their hand.
      int getHighiestDoubleTile()
      Gets the value of the highest double Tile on their hand.
      java.lang.String getName()
      Returns their name(e.g.
      int GetPoints()
      Gets their collected points
      Tile getTileByIndex(int x)
      Gets the Tile in a specified position of their hand
      boolean handIsEmpty()
      Checks if has no more tiles on their hand.

      Removes a Tile from their hand.

    • Method Detail

      • fillhand

        void fillhand(SetOfTiles set)
        Fills their hand with a SetOfTiles.
        Parameters:
        set - setOfTiles representing their hand.

      • ClearHand

        void ClearHand()
        Their current hand gets cleared and a new one is created.

      • getHandpoints

        int getHandpoints()
        Gets the total points from every Tile(sum) on their hand.
        Returns:
        an integer representing the sum of every value of every Tile on their hand.

      • getHighiestDoubleTile

        int getHighiestDoubleTile()
        Gets the value of the highest double Tile on their hand. Returns -1 if doesnt exist. e.g. [6,6] -- 6
        Returns:
        the value of the highest double Tile on their hand.

      • GetPoints

        int GetPoints()
        Gets their collected points
        Returns:
        points it has collected

      • removeTileByIndex

        boolean removeTileByIndex(int x)
        Removes a Tile from their hand.
        Parameters:
        x - an integer representing a Tile on their hand e.g. the 1st one
        Returns:
        true if it was removed,otherwise false

      • getTileByIndex

        Tile getTileByIndex(int x)
        Gets the Tile in a specified position of their hand
        Parameters:
        x - an integer representing a Tile on their hand e.g. the 1st one
        Returns:
        true if Tile was found in their hand,otherwise false.

      • handIsEmpty

        boolean handIsEmpty()
        Checks if has no more tiles on their hand.
        Returns:
        true if has no more tiles on their hand,otherwise false.

      • addPoints

        void addPoints(int x)
        * Adds a specified number of points(x) to their points.
        Parameters:
        x - an integer representing the points to be added.

      • getHand

        SetOfTiles getHand()
        Returns their hand.
        Returns:
        a SetOfTiles representing their hand.

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
        Returns their name(e.g. Kostas,Bot 1,Bot 3)
        Returns:
        a String representing Player's name.
